qas.question: What type of satellites does the American GPS system use?
What type of satellites does the BeiDou-1 system use?
What is the purpose of the BeiDou-1 system using stallites in geostationary orbit?

answers.text: the system does not require a large constellation of satellites

qas.question: What service area is covered by the BeiDou-1 system?

answers.text: from longitude 70°E to 140°E and from latitude 5°N to 55°N

qas.question: What is the frequency of the BeiDou-1 system?
BeiDou-1, along with American GPS, use which type of satellites?
BeiDou-1, along with Russian GLONASS, use which type of satellites?
BeiDou-1, along with European Galileo systems, use which type of satellites?
Which is a frequency of the vehicular system?
Although, BeiDou-1 uses medium Earth orbit satellites, American GPS systems use which kind?

context: Unlike the American GPS, Russian GLONASS, and European Galileo systems, which use <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>medium Earth orbit satellites<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, BeiDou-1 uses <a1_0><b9_0>satellites in geostationary orbit<a1_0/>.<b9_0/> This means that <a2_0>the system does not require a large constellation of satellites<a2_0/>, but it also limits the coverage to areas on Earth where the satellites are visible. The area that can be serviced is <a3_0>from longitude 70°E to 140°E and from latitude 5°N to 55°N<a3_0/>. A frequency of the system is <a4_0><b8_0>2491.75 MHz<b8_0/><a4_0/>.
